edu.ucla.sspace.text

Class DirectoryCorpusReader<D extends Document>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.sspace.text.DirectoryCorpusReader<D>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CorpusReader<D>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BloglinesCorpusReader, BloglinesCorpusReader, ChildesCorpusReader, ChildesCorpusReader, SenseEvalDependencyCorpusReader, TemporalBloglinesCorpusReader, TemporalUsenetCorpusReader, UsenetCorpusReader, UsenetCorpusReader

    public abstract class DirectoryCorpusReader<D extends Document>
extends Object
implements CorpusReader<D>
    An abstract base class for corpus reading iterators that need to traverse through a large nested directory structure to find files containing text. Sub classes will need to implement a method that will traverse a single file at a time and return strings holding the contents of a single document..

    Note that initialize(String) uses the argument as a directory name, and not the name of a text file to be processed. This CorpusReader instead uses that directory name as the root directory of the nested directory structure. This class also does not implement initialize(Reader).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectoryCorpusReader()
      Constructs a new DirectoryCoprusReader that uses no DocumentPreprocessor.
      DirectoryCorpusReader(DocumentPreprocessor processor)
      Constructs a new DirectoryCoprusReader that uses processor to pre-process any raw text extracted from a corpus file.

      • read

        public Iterator<D> read(File dir)
        Initializes the DirectoryCorpusReader to start processing all files accessbile under the directory specified by dirName.
        Specified by:
        read in interface CorpusReader<D extends Document>
        Parameters:
        dirName - A directory path containing a large directory structure that contains numerous text files that can be processed by a subclass of DirectoryCoprusReader.

      • read

        public Iterator<D> read(Reader reader)
        Unsupported.
        Specified by:
        read in interface CorpusReader<D extends Document>
        Parameters:
        reader - A Reader that will extract text from a data source, such as a URL, a File, a data stream, or any other source accesible via the Reader interface. Each CorpusReader should specify the expected text format, be it an XML schema or some other unique format.

      • corpusIterator

        protected abstract Iterator<D> corpusIterator(Iterator<File> fileIter)
        Returns an Iterator over documents contained in the Files traversed by fileIter. Sub-classes are encouraged to sub-class BaseFileIterator for the return value of this method.
